contents.content:
You have investigated how to color balance and chromatically order an image to communicate scientific information. Using the color filter tools, you have:

  • Identified the hottest and coolest stars in a star cluster (see page 12)
  • Located star forming regions in a spiral galaxy (see page 14)
  • Detected far away galaxies (see page 16)

Next you will create a new color image and investigate a scientific question of your choosing.

images.figText: Comparison of visible color wavelength ranges with Rubin Observatory filters (nm = nanometers)

The Antennae Galaxies (also known as NGC 4038 and 4039) are a pair of distorted colliding spiral galaxies about 70 million light-years away, in the constellation of Corvus (The Crow).
Source: Wikimedia Commons Credit: ALMA (ESO/NAOJ/NRAO). Visible light image: the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope

question.label: What types of objects would you like to investigate?

What question do you want to answer about your object? You may choose a question from the list below or develop your own question:

  • Which are the hottest and coolest stars in a cluster?
  • Where are the star forming regions in a galaxy?
  • Which is a very far away galaxy?
What filters will you use for conducting your investigation? Why? (You donâ€™t have to use all six filters.)
